-- | The AWS resources for which the exclusion preview pertains.
exclusionPreview_scopes :: Lens' ExclusionPreview (NonEmpty Scope)

-- | Includes details about the failed items.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailedItemDetails</a> smart constructor.
data FailedItemDetails
FailedItemDetails' :: FailedItemErrorCode -> Bool -> FailedItemDetails

-- | The status code of a failed item.
[$sel:failureCode:FailedItemDetails'] :: FailedItemDetails -> FailedItemErrorCode

-- | Indicates whether you can immediately retry a request for this item
--   for a specified resource.
[$sel:retryable:FailedItemDetails'] :: FailedItemDetails -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>FailedItemDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureCode:FailedItemDetails'</a>,
--   <a>failedItemDetails_failureCode</a> - The status code of a failed
--   item.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retryable:FailedItemDetails'</a>,
--   <a>failedItemDetails_retryable</a> - Indicates whether you can
--   immediately retry a request for this item for a specified resource.
newFailedItemDetails :: FailedItemErrorCode -> Bool -> FailedItemDetails

-- | The status code of a failed item.
failedItemDetails_failureCode :: Lens' FailedItemDetails FailedItemErrorCode

-- | Indicates whether you can immediately retry a request for this item
--   for a specified resource.
failedItemDetails_retryable :: Lens' FailedItemDetails Bool

-- | Contains information about an Amazon Inspector finding. This data type
--   is used as the response element in the DescribeFindings action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFinding</a> smart constructor.
data Finding
Finding' :: Maybe AssetAttributes -> Maybe Severity -> Maybe AssetType -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InspectorServiceAttributes -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> [Attribute] -> [Attribute] -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Finding

-- | A collection of attributes of the host from which the finding is
--   generated.
[$sel:assetAttributes:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe AssetAttributes

-- | The finding severity. Values can be set to High, Medium, Low, and
--   Informational.
[$sel:severity:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Severity

-- | The type of the host from which the finding is generated.
[$sel:assetType:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe AssetType

-- | The numeric value of the finding severity.
[$sel:numericSeverity:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Double

-- | The name of the finding.
[$sel:title:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the finding.
[$sel:id:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The data element is set to "Inspector".
[$sel:service:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | This data type is used in the Finding data type.
[$sel:serviceAttributes:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe InspectorServiceAttributes

-- | This data element is currently not used.
[$sel:confidence:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Natural

-- | The recommendation for the finding.
[$sel:recommendation:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | This data element is currently not used.
[$sel:indicatorOfCompromise:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the finding.
[$sel:description:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Text

-- | The schema version of this data type.
[$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'] :: Finding -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ARN that specifies the finding.
[$sel:arn:Finding'] :: Finding -> Text

-- | The system-defined attributes for the finding.
[$sel:attributes:Finding'] :: Finding -> [Attribute]

-- | The user-defined attributes that are assigned to the finding.
[$sel:userAttributes:Finding'] :: Finding -> [Attribute]

-- | The time when the finding was generated.
[$sel:createdAt:Finding'] :: Finding -> POSIX

-- | The time when AddAttributesToFindings is called.
[$sel:updatedAt:Finding'] :: Finding -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Finding</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetAttributes:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_assetAttributes</a> -
--   A collection of attributes of the host from which the finding is
--   generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severity:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_severity</a> - The finding
--   severity. Values can be set to High, Medium, Low, and Informational.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetType:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_assetType</a> - The type of
--   the host from which the finding is generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numericSeverity:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_numericSeverity</a> -
--   The numeric value of the finding severity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_title</a> - The name of the
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_id</a> - The ID of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_service</a> - The data
--   element is set to "Inspector".
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceAttributes:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_serviceAttributes</a> - This data type is used in the
--   Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:confidence:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_confidence</a> - This data
--   element is currently not used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendation:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_recommendation</a> -
--   The recommendation for the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indicatorOfCompromise:Finding'</a>,
--   <a>finding_indicatorOfCompromise</a> - This data element is currently
--   not used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_description</a> - The
--   description of the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaVersion:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_schemaVersion</a> - The
--   schema version of this data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_arn</a> - The ARN that specifies
--   the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_attributes</a> - The
--   system-defined attributes for the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userAttributes:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_userAttributes</a> -
--   The user-defined attributes that are assigned to the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_createdAt</a> - The time
--   when the finding was generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updatedAt:Finding'</a>, <a>finding_updatedAt</a> - The time
--   when AddAttributesToFindings is called.
newFinding :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Finding

-- | A collection of attributes of the host from which the finding is
--   generated.
finding_assetAttributes :: Lens' Finding (Maybe AssetAttributes)

-- | The finding severity. Values can be set to High, Medium, Low, and
--   Informational.
finding_severity :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Severity)

-- | The type of the host from which the finding is generated.
finding_assetType :: Lens' Finding (Maybe AssetType)

-- | The numeric value of the finding severity.
finding_numericSeverity :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Double)

-- | The name of the finding.
finding_title :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the finding.
finding_id :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The data element is set to "Inspector".
finding_service :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | This data type is used in the Finding data type.
finding_serviceAttributes :: Lens' Finding (Maybe InspectorServiceAttributes)

-- | This data element is currently not used.
finding_confidence :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Natural)

-- | The recommendation for the finding.
finding_recommendation :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | This data element is currently not used.
finding_indicatorOfCompromise :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the finding.
finding_description :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema version of this data type.
finding_schemaVersion :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN that specifies the finding.
finding_arn :: Lens' Finding Text

-- | The system-defined attributes for the finding.
finding_attributes :: Lens' Finding [Attribute]

-- | The user-defined attributes that are assigned to the finding.
finding_userAttributes :: Lens' Finding [Attribute]

-- | The time when the finding was generated.
finding_createdAt :: Lens' Finding UTCTime

-- | The time when AddAttributesToFindings is called.
finding_updatedAt :: Lens' Finding UTCTime

-- | This data type is used as a request parameter in the ListFindings
--   action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFindingFilter</a> smart constructor.
data FindingFilter
FindingFilter' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe TimestampRange -> Maybe [Severity] -> Maybe [Attribute] -> Maybe [Attribute] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> FindingFilter

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>agentId</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:agentIds:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>rulesPackageArn</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:rulesPackageArns:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The time range during which the finding is generated.
[$sel:creationTimeRange:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe TimestampRange

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>severity</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:severities:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Severity]

-- | For a record to match a filter, the list of values that are specified
--   for this data type property must be contained in the list of values of
--   the <b>attributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:attributes:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Attribute]

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must be contained in the list of values of the
--   <b>userAttributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:userAttributes:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Attribute]

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>autoScalingGroup</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:autoScalingGroups:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>ruleName</b> property of the Finding data type.
[$sel:ruleNames:FindingFilter'] :: FindingFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>FindingFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentIds:FindingFilter'</a>, <a>findingFilter_agentIds</a> -
--   For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>agentId</b> property of the Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rulesPackageArns:FindingFilter'</a>,
--   <a>findingFilter_rulesPackageArns</a> - For a record to match a
--   filter, one of the values that is specified for this data type
--   property must be the exact match of the value of the
--   <b>rulesPackageArn</b> property of the Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTimeRange:FindingFilter'</a>,
--   <a>findingFilter_creationTimeRange</a> - The time range during which
--   the finding is generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:severities:FindingFilter'</a>, <a>findingFilter_severities</a>
--   - For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>severity</b> property of the Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:FindingFilter'</a>, <a>findingFilter_attributes</a>
--   - For a record to match a filter, the list of values that are
--   specified for this data type property must be contained in the list of
--   values of the <b>attributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userAttributes:FindingFilter'</a>,
--   <a>findingFilter_userAttributes</a> - For a record to match a filter,
--   the value that is specified for this data type property must be
--   contained in the list of values of the <b>userAttributes</b> property
--   of the Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingGroups:FindingFilter'</a>,
--   <a>findingFilter_autoScalingGroups</a> - For a record to match a
--   filter, one of the values that is specified for this data type
--   property must be the exact match of the value of the
--   <b>autoScalingGroup</b> property of the Finding data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleNames:FindingFilter'</a>, <a>findingFilter_ruleNames</a> -
--   For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>ruleName</b> property of the Finding data type.
newFindingFilter :: FindingFilter

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>agentId</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_agentIds :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>rulesPackageArn</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | The time range during which the finding is generated.
findingFilter_creationTimeRange :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe TimestampRange)

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>severity</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_severities :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Severity])

-- | For a record to match a filter, the list of values that are specified
--   for this data type property must be contained in the list of values of
--   the <b>attributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_attributes :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must be contained in the list of values of the
--   <b>userAttributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_userAttributes :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>autoScalingGroup</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_autoScalingGroups :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>ruleName</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_ruleNames :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | This data type is used in the Finding data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInspectorServiceAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data InspectorServiceAttributes
InspectorServiceAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Natural -> InspectorServiceAttributes

-- | The ARN of the rules package that is used to generate the finding.
[$sel:rulesPackageArn:InspectorServiceAttributes'] :: InspectorServiceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the assessment run during which the finding is generated.
[$sel:assessmentRunArn:InspectorServiceAttributes'] :: InspectorServiceAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The schema version of this data type.
[$sel:schemaVersion:InspectorServiceAttributes'] :: InspectorServiceAttributes -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>InspectorServiceAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rulesPackageArn:InspectorServiceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>inspectorServiceAttributes_rulesPackageArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   rules package that is used to generate the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:InspectorServiceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>inspectorServiceAttributes_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   assessment run during which the finding is generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schemaVersion:InspectorServiceAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>inspectorServiceAttributes_schemaVersion</a> - The schema version
--   of this data type.
newInspectorServiceAttributes :: Natural -> InspectorServiceAttributes

-- | The ARN of the rules package that is used to generate the finding.
inspectorServiceAttributes_rulesPackageArn :: Lens' InspectorServiceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the assessment run during which the finding is generated.
inspectorServiceAttributes_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' InspectorServiceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema version of this data type.
inspectorServiceAttributes_schemaVersion :: Lens' InspectorServiceAttributes Natural

-- | Contains information about the network interfaces interacting with an
--   EC2 instance. This data type is used as one of the elements of the
--   AssetAttributes data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkInterface</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkInterface
NetworkInterface' :: Maybe [PrivateIp] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [SecurityGroup] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkInterface

-- | A list of the private IP addresses associated with the network
--   interface. Includes the privateDnsName and privateIpAddress.
[$sel:privateIpAddresses:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe [PrivateIp]

-- | The IP addresses associated with the network interface.
[$sel:ipv6Addresses:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of the security groups associated with the network interface.
--   Includes the groupId and groupName.
[$sel:securityGroups:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe [SecurityGroup]

-- | The name of a public DNS associated with the network interface.
[$sel:publicDnsName:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a subnet associated with the network interface.
[$sel:subnetId:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the network interface.
[$sel:networkInterfaceId:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a private DNS associated with the network interface.
[$sel:privateDnsName:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a VPC associated with the network interface.
[$sel:vpcId:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The public IP address from which the network interface is reachable.
[$sel:publicIp:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | The private IP address associated with the network interface.
[$sel:privateIpAddress:NetworkInterface'] :: NetworkInterface -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkInterface</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIpAddresses:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_privateIpAddresses</a> - A list of the private IP
--   addresses associated with the network interface. Includes the
--   privateDnsName and privateIpAddress.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipv6Addresses:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_ipv6Addresses</a> - The IP addresses associated
--   with the network interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroups:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_securityGroups</a> - A list of the security groups
--   associated with the network interface. Includes the groupId and
--   groupName.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDnsName:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_publicDnsName</a> - The name of a public DNS
--   associated with the network interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_subnetId</a> - The ID of a subnet associated with
--   the network interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInterfaceId:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_networkInterfaceId</a> - The ID of the network
--   interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDnsName:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_privateDnsName</a> - The name of a private DNS
--   associated with the network interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:NetworkInterface'</a>, <a>networkInterface_vpcId</a> -
--   The ID of a VPC associated with the network interface.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIp:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_publicIp</a> - The public IP address from which
--   the network interface is reachable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIpAddress:NetworkInterface'</a>,
--   <a>networkInterface_privateIpAddress</a> - The private IP address
--   associated with the network interface.
newNetworkInterface :: NetworkInterface

-- | A list of the private IP addresses associated with the network
--   interface. Includes the privateDnsName and privateIpAddress.
networkInterface_privateIpAddresses :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe [PrivateIp])

-- | The IP addresses associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_ipv6Addresses :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of the security groups associated with the network interface.
--   Includes the groupId and groupName.
networkInterface_securityGroups :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe [SecurityGroup])

-- | The name of a public DNS associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_publicDnsName :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a subnet associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_subnetId :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the network interface.
networkInterface_networkInterfaceId :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a private DNS associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_privateDnsName :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a VPC associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The public IP address from which the network interface is reachable.
networkInterface_publicIp :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_privateIpAddress :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about a private IP address associated with a
--   network interface. This data type is used as a response element in the
--   DescribeFindings action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPrivateIp</a> smart constructor.
data PrivateIp
PrivateIp' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PrivateIp

-- | The DNS name of the private IP address.
[$sel:privateDnsName:PrivateIp'] :: PrivateIp -> Maybe Text

-- | The full IP address of the network inteface.
[$sel:privateIpAddress:PrivateIp'] :: PrivateIp -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PrivateIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDnsName:PrivateIp'</a>, <a>privateIp_privateDnsName</a>
--   - The DNS name of the private IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIpAddress:PrivateIp'</a>,
--   <a>privateIp_privateIpAddress</a> - The full IP address of the network
--   inteface.
newPrivateIp :: PrivateIp

-- | The DNS name of the private IP address.
privateIp_privateDnsName :: Lens' PrivateIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The full IP address of the network inteface.
privateIp_privateIpAddress :: Lens' PrivateIp (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about a resource group. The resource group
--   defines a set of tags that, when queried, identify the AWS resources
--   that make up the assessment target. This data type is used as the
--   response element in the DescribeResourceGroups action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceGroup</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceGroup
ResourceGroup' :: Text -> NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag -> POSIX -> ResourceGroup

-- | The ARN of the resource group.
[$sel:arn:ResourceGroup'] :: ResourceGroup -> Text

-- | The tags (key and value pairs) of the resource group. This data type
--   property is used in the CreateResourceGroup action.
[$sel:tags:ResourceGroup'] :: ResourceGroup -> NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag

-- | The time at which resource group is created.
[$sel:createdAt:ResourceGroup'] :: ResourceGroup -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ResourceGroup'</a>, <a>resourceGroup_arn</a> - The ARN of
--   the resource group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ResourceGroup'</a>, <a>resourceGroup_tags</a> - The tags
--   (key and value pairs) of the resource group. This data type property
--   is used in the CreateResourceGroup action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ResourceGroup'</a>, <a>resourceGroup_createdAt</a> -
--   The time at which resource group is created.
newResourceGroup :: Text -> NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag -> UTCTime -> ResourceGroup

-- | The ARN of the resource group.
resourceGroup_arn :: Lens' ResourceGroup Text

-- | The tags (key and value pairs) of the resource group. This data type
--   property is used in the CreateResourceGroup action.
resourceGroup_tags :: Lens' ResourceGroup (NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag)

-- | The time at which resource group is created.
resourceGroup_createdAt :: Lens' ResourceGroup UTCTime

-- | This data type is used as one of the elements of the ResourceGroup
--   data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceGroupTag</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceGroupTag
ResourceGroupTag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ResourceGroupTag

-- | The value assigned to a tag key.
[$sel:value:ResourceGroupTag'] :: ResourceGroupTag -> Maybe Text

-- | A tag key.
[$sel:key:ResourceGroupTag'] :: ResourceGroupTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceGroupTag</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ResourceGroupTag'</a>, <a>resourceGroupTag_value</a> -
--   The value assigned to a tag key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ResourceGroupTag'</a>, <a>resourceGroupTag_key</a> - A tag
--   key.
newResourceGroupTag :: Text -> ResourceGroupTag

-- | The value assigned to a tag key.
resourceGroupTag_value :: Lens' ResourceGroupTag (Maybe Text)

-- | A tag key.
resourceGroupTag_key :: Lens' ResourceGroupTag Text

-- | Contains information about an Amazon Inspector rules package. This
--   data type is used as the response element in the DescribeRulesPackages
--   action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRulesPackage</a> smart constructor.
data RulesPackage
RulesPackage' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RulesPackage

-- | The description of the rules package.
[$sel:description:RulesPackage'] :: RulesPackage -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the rules package.
[$sel:arn:RulesPackage'] :: RulesPackage -> Text

-- | The name of the rules package.
[$sel:name:RulesPackage'] :: RulesPackage -> Text

-- | The version ID of the rules package.
[$sel:version:RulesPackage'] :: RulesPackage -> Text

-- | The provider of the rules package.
[$sel:provider:RulesPackage'] :: RulesPackage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RulesPackage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RulesPackage'</a>, <a>rulesPackage_description</a>
--   - The description of the rules package.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:RulesPackage'</a>, <a>rulesPackage_arn</a> - The ARN of
--   the rules package.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RulesPackage'</a>, <a>rulesPackage_name</a> - The name of
--   the rules package.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:RulesPackage'</a>, <a>rulesPackage_version</a> - The
--   version ID of the rules package.
--   
--   <a>$sel:provider:RulesPackage'</a>, <a>rulesPackage_provider</a> - The
--   provider of the rules package.
newRulesPackage :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RulesPackage

-- | The description of the rules package.
rulesPackage_description :: Lens' RulesPackage (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the rules package.
rulesPackage_arn :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The name of the rules package.
rulesPackage_name :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The version ID of the rules package.
rulesPackage_version :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The provider of the rules package.
rulesPackage_provider :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | This data type contains key-value pairs that identify various Amazon
--   resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScope</a> smart constructor.
data Scope
Scope' :: Maybe ScopeType -> Maybe Text -> Scope

-- | The type of the scope.
[$sel:key:Scope'] :: Scope -> Maybe ScopeType

-- | The resource identifier for the specified scope type.
[$sel:value:Scope'] :: Scope -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Scope</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Scope'</a>, <a>scope_key</a> - The type of the scope.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Scope'</a>, <a>scope_value</a> - The resource identifier
--   for the specified scope type.
newScope :: Scope

-- | The type of the scope.
scope_key :: Lens' Scope (Maybe ScopeType)

-- | The resource identifier for the specified scope type.
scope_value :: Lens' Scope (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about a security group associated with a network
--   interface. This data type is used as one of the elements of the
--   NetworkInterface data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSecurityGroup</a> smart constructor.
data SecurityGroup
SecurityGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SecurityGroup

-- | The name of the security group.
[$sel:groupName:SecurityGroup'] :: SecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the security group.
[$sel:groupId:SecurityGroup'] :: SecurityGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SecurityGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupName:SecurityGroup'</a>, <a>securityGroup_groupName</a> -
--   The name of the security group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:SecurityGroup'</a>, <a>securityGroup_groupId</a> - The
--   ID of the security group.
newSecurityGroup :: SecurityGroup

-- | The name of the security group.
securityGroup_groupName :: Lens' SecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the security group.
securityGroup_groupId :: Lens' SecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | This data type is used as a response element in the
--   ListEventSubscriptions action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscription</a> smart constructor.
data Subscription
Subscription' :: Text -> Text -> NonEmpty EventSubscription -> Subscription

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which the SNS notification is sent.
[$sel:resourceArn:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic to which
--   the SNS notifications are sent.
[$sel:topicArn:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> Text

-- | The list of existing event subscriptions.
[$sel:eventSubscriptions:Subscription'] :: Subscription -> NonEmpty EventSubscription

-- | Create a value of <a>Subscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_resourceArn</a>
--   - The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which the SNS notification is sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:Subscription'</a>, <a>subscription_topicArn</a> - The
--   ARN of the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic to which the
--   SNS notifications are sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventSubscriptions:Subscription'</a>,
--   <a>subscription_eventSubscriptions</a> - The list of existing event
--   subscriptions.
newSubscription :: Text -> Text -> NonEmpty EventSubscription -> Subscription

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which the SNS notification is sent.
subscription_resourceArn :: Lens' Subscription Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic to which
--   the SNS notifications are sent.
subscription_topicArn :: Lens' Subscription Text

-- | The list of existing event subscriptions.
subscription_eventSubscriptions :: Lens' Subscription (NonEmpty EventSubscription)

-- | A key and value pair. This data type is used as a request parameter in
--   the SetTagsForResource action and a response element in the
--   ListTagsForResource action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | A value assigned to a tag key.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | A tag key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - A value assigned to a tag
--   key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - A tag key.
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | A value assigned to a tag key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A tag key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The metadata about the Amazon Inspector application data metrics
--   collected by the agent. This data type is used as the response element
--   in the GetTelemetryMetadata action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTelemetryMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data TelemetryMetadata
TelemetryMetadata' :: Maybe Integer -> Text -> Integer -> TelemetryMetadata

-- | The data size of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
[$sel:dataSize:TelemetryMetadata'] :: TelemetryMetadata -> Maybe Integer

-- | A specific type of behavioral data that is collected by the agent.
[$sel:messageType:TelemetryMetadata'] :: TelemetryMetadata -> Text

-- | The count of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
[$sel:count:TelemetryMetadata'] :: TelemetryMetadata -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TelemetryMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSize:TelemetryMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>telemetryMetadata_dataSize</a> - The data size of messages that the
--   agent sends to the Amazon Inspector service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageType:TelemetryMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>telemetryMetadata_messageType</a> - A specific type of behavioral
--   data that is collected by the agent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:TelemetryMetadata'</a>, <a>telemetryMetadata_count</a> -
--   The count of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
newTelemetryMetadata :: Text -> Integer -> TelemetryMetadata

-- | The data size of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
telemetryMetadata_dataSize :: Lens' TelemetryMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | A specific type of behavioral data that is collected by the agent.
telemetryMetadata_messageType :: Lens' TelemetryMetadata Text

-- | The count of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
telemetryMetadata_count :: Lens' TelemetryMetadata Integer

-- | This data type is used in the AssessmentRunFilter data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimestampRange</a> smart constructor.
data TimestampRange
TimestampRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> TimestampRange

-- | The minimum value of the timestamp range.
[$sel:beginDate:TimestampRange'] :: TimestampRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The maximum value of the timestamp range.
[$sel:endDate:TimestampRange'] :: TimestampRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TimestampRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginDate:TimestampRange'</a>, <a>timestampRange_beginDate</a>
--   - The minimum value of the timestamp range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:TimestampRange'</a>, <a>timestampRange_endDate</a> -
--   The maximum value of the timestamp range.
newTimestampRange :: TimestampRange

-- | The minimum value of the timestamp range.
timestampRange_beginDate :: Lens' TimestampRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The maximum value of the timestamp range.
timestampRange_endDate :: Lens' TimestampRange (Maybe UTCTime)


-- | Enables the process of sending Amazon Simple Notification Service
--   (SNS) notifications about a specified event to a specified SNS topic.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.SubscribeToEvent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscribeToEvent</a> smart constructor.
data SubscribeToEvent
SubscribeToEvent' :: Text -> InspectorEvent -> Text -> SubscribeToEvent

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which you want to receive SNS notifications.
[$sel:resourceArn:SubscribeToEvent'] :: SubscribeToEvent -> Text

-- | The event for which you want to receive SNS notifications.
[$sel:event:SubscribeToEvent'] :: SubscribeToEvent -> InspectorEvent

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to which the SNS notifications are sent.
[$sel:topicArn:SubscribeToEvent'] :: SubscribeToEvent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SubscribeToEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:SubscribeToEvent'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToEvent_resourceArn</a> - The ARN of the assessment
--   template that is used during the event for which you want to receive
--   SNS notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:event:SubscribeToEvent'</a>, <a>subscribeToEvent_event</a> -
--   The event for which you want to receive SNS notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:SubscribeToEvent'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeToEvent_topicArn</a> - The ARN of the SNS topic to which
--   the SNS notifications are sent.
newSubscribeToEvent :: Text -> InspectorEvent -> Text -> SubscribeToEvent

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which you want to receive SNS notifications.
subscribeToEvent_resourceArn :: Lens' SubscribeToEvent Text

-- | The event for which you want to receive SNS notifications.
subscribeToEvent_event :: Lens' SubscribeToEvent InspectorEvent

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to which the SNS notifications are sent.
subscribeToEvent_topicArn :: Lens' SubscribeToEvent Text

-- | Stops the assessment run that is specified by the ARN of the
--   assessment run.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopAssessmentRun</a> smart constructor.
data StopAssessmentRun
StopAssessmentRun' :: Maybe StopAction -> Text -> StopAssessmentRun

-- | An input option that can be set to either START_EVALUATION or
--   SKIP_EVALUATION. START_EVALUATION (the default value), stops the AWS
--   agent from collecting data and begins the results evaluation and the
--   findings generation process. SKIP_EVALUATION cancels the assessment
--   run immediately, after which no findings are generated.
[$sel:stopAction:StopAssessmentRun'] :: StopAssessmentRun -> Maybe StopAction

-- | The ARN of the assessment run that you want to stop.
[$sel:assessmentRunArn:StopAssessmentRun'] :: StopAssessmentRun -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopAssessmentRun</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopAction:StopAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>stopAssessmentRun_stopAction</a> - An input option that can be set
--   to either START_EVALUATION or SKIP_EVALUATION. START_EVALUATION (the
--   default value), stops the AWS agent from collecting data and begins
--   the results evaluation and the findings generation process.
--   SKIP_EVALUATION cancels the assessment run immediately, after which no
--   findings are generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:StopAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>stopAssessmentRun_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN of the assessment
--   run that you want to stop.
newStopAssessmentRun :: Text -> StopAssessmentRun

-- | An input option that can be set to either START_EVALUATION or
--   SKIP_EVALUATION. START_EVALUATION (the default value), stops the AWS
--   agent from collecting data and begins the results evaluation and the
--   findings generation process. SKIP_EVALUATION cancels the assessment
--   run immediately, after which no findings are generated.
stopAssessmentRun_stopAction :: Lens' StopAssessmentRun (Maybe StopAction)

-- | The ARN of the assessment run that you want to stop.
stopAssessmentRun_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' StopAssessmentRun Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopAssessmentRunResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StopAssessmentRunResponse
StopAssessmentRunResponse' :: StopAssessmentRunResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>StopAssessmentRunResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newStopAssessmentRunResponse :: StopAssessmentRunResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRunResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRunResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRunResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRunResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRunResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Inspector.StopAssessmentRun.StopAssessmentRun

-- | Starts the assessment run specified by the ARN of the assessment
--   template. For this API to function properly, you must not exceed the
--   limit of running up to 500 concurrent agents per AWS account.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.StartAssessmentRun

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartAssessmentRun</a> smart constructor.
data StartAssessmentRun
StartAssessmentRun' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> StartAssessmentRun

-- | You can specify the name for the assessment run. The name must be
--   unique for the assessment template whose ARN is used to start the
--   assessment run.
[$sel:assessmentRunName:StartAssessmentRun'] :: StartAssessmentRun -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the assessment template of the assessment run that you want
--   to start.
[$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:StartAssessmentRun'] :: StartAssessmentRun -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartAssessmentRun</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunName:StartAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName</a> - You can specify the name
--   for the assessment run. The name must be unique for the assessment
--   template whose ARN is used to start the assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:StartAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>startAssessmentRun_assessmentTemplateArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   assessment template of the assessment run that you want to start.
newStartAssessmentRun :: Text -> StartAssessmentRun

-- | You can specify the name for the assessment run. The name must be
--   unique for the assessment template whose ARN is used to start the
--   assessment run.
startAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName :: Lens' StartAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the assessment template of the assessment run that you want
--   to start.
startAssessmentRun_assessmentTemplateArn :: Lens' StartAssessmentRun Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartAssessmentRunResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartAssessmentRunResponse
StartAssessmentRunResponse' :: Int -> Text -> StartAssessmentRunResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StartAssessmentRunResponse'] :: StartAssessmentRunResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN of the assessment run that has been started.
[$sel:assessmentRunArn:StartAssessmentRunResponse'] :: StartAssessmentRunResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartAssessmentRunResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StartAssessmentRunResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startAssessmentRunResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:StartAssessmentRunResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startAssessmentRunResponse_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN of the
--   assessment run that has been started.
newStartAssessmentRunResponse :: Int -> Text -> StartAssessmentRunResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
startAssessmentRunResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartAssessmentRunResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the assessment run that has been started.
startAssessmentRunResponse_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' StartAssessmentRunResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.StartAssessmentRun.StartAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.StartAssessmentRun.StartAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.StartAssessmentRun.StartAssessmentRun
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.StartAssessmentRun.StartAssessmentRun

-- | Sets tags (key and value pairs) to the assessment template that is
--   specified by the ARN of the assessment template.

--   assessment template.

--   template that you want to set tags to.

-- | Removes entire attributes (key and value pairs) from the findings that
--   are specified by the ARNs of the findings where an attribute with the
--   specified key exists.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.RemoveAttributesFromFindings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveAttributesFromFindings</a> smart constructor.
data RemoveAttributesFromFindings
RemoveAttributesFromFindings' :: NonEmpty Text -> [Text] -> RemoveAttributesFromFindings

-- | The ARNs that specify the findings that you want to remove attributes
--   from.
[$sel:findingArns:RemoveAttributesFromFindings'] :: RemoveAttributesFromFindings -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The array of attribute keys that you want to remove from specified
--   findings.
[$sel:attributeKeys:RemoveAttributesFromFindings'] :: RemoveAttributesFromFindings -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>RemoveAttributesFromFindings</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingArns:RemoveAttributesFromFindings'</a>,
--   <a>removeAttributesFromFindings_findingArns</a> - The ARNs that
--   specify the findings that you want to remove attributes from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeKeys:RemoveAttributesFromFindings'</a>,
--   <a>removeAttributesFromFindings_attributeKeys</a> - The array of
--   attribute keys that you want to remove from specified findings.
newRemoveAttributesFromFindings :: NonEmpty Text -> RemoveAttributesFromFindings

-- | The ARNs that specify the findings that you want to remove attributes
--   from.
removeAttributesFromFindings_findingArns :: Lens' RemoveAttributesFromFindings (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The array of attribute keys that you want to remove from specified
--   findings.
removeAttributesFromFindings_attributeKeys :: Lens' RemoveAttributesFromFindings [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse
RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse' :: Int -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails -> RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse'] :: RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse -> Int

-- | Attributes details that cannot be described. An error code is provided
--   for each failed item.
[$sel:failedItems:RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse'] :: RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>removeAttributesFromFindingsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedItems:RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>removeAttributesFromFindingsResponse_failedItems</a> - Attributes
--   details that cannot be described. An error code is provided for each
--   failed item.
newRemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse :: Int -> RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
removeAttributesFromFindingsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse Int

-- | Attributes details that cannot be described. An error code is provided
--   for each failed item.
removeAttributesFromFindingsResponse_failedItems :: Lens' RemoveAttributesFromFindingsResponse (HashMap Text FailedItemDetails)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.RemoveAttributesFromFindings.RemoveAttributesFromFindings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.RemoveAttributesFromFindings.RemoveAttributesFromFindings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.RemoveAttributesFromFindings.RemoveAttributesFromFindings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.RemoveAttributesFromFindings.RemoveAttributesFromFindings

-- | Previews the agents installed on the EC2 instances that are part of
--   the specified assessment target.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.PreviewAgents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPreviewAgents</a> smart constructor.
data PreviewAgents
PreviewAgents' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> PreviewAgents

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>PreviewAgents</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
[$sel:nextToken:PreviewAgents'] :: PreviewAgents -> Maybe Text

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
[$sel:maxResults:PreviewAgents'] :: PreviewAgents -> Maybe Int

-- | The ARN of the assessment target whose agents you want to preview.
[$sel:previewAgentsArn:PreviewAgents'] :: PreviewAgents -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PreviewAgents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:PreviewAgents'</a>, <a>previewAgents_nextToken</a> -
--   You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>PreviewAgents</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:PreviewAgents'</a>, <a>previewAgents_maxResults</a>
--   - You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items
--   you want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value
--   is 500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previewAgentsArn:PreviewAgents'</a>,
--   <a>previewAgents_previewAgentsArn</a> - The ARN of the assessment
--   target whose agents you want to preview.
newPreviewAgents :: Text -> PreviewAgents

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>PreviewAgents</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
previewAgents_maxResults :: Lens' PreviewAgents (Maybe Int)

-- | The ARN of the assessment target whose agents you want to preview.
previewAgents_previewAgentsArn :: Lens' PreviewAgents Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPreviewAgentsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PreviewAgentsResponse
PreviewAgentsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [AgentPreview] -> PreviewAgentsResponse

-- | When a response is generated, if there is more data to be listed, this
--   parameter is present in the response and contains the value to use for
--   the <b>nextToken</b> parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If
--   there is no more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.

-- | The resulting list of agents.

--   fields omitted.

-- | Lists findings that are generated by the assessment runs that are
--   specified by the ARNs of the assessment runs.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.ListFindings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListFindings</a> smart constructor.
data ListFindings
ListFindings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe FindingFilter -> ListFindings

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>ListFindings</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
[$sel:nextToken:ListFindings'] :: ListFindings -> Maybe Text

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
[$sel:maxResults:ListFindings'] :: ListFindings -> Maybe Int

-- | The ARNs of the assessment runs that generate the findings that you
--   want to list.
[$sel:assessmentRunArns:ListFindings'] :: ListFindings -> Maybe [Text]

-- | You can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included
--   in the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
[$sel:filter':ListFindings'] :: ListFindings -> Maybe FindingFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListFindings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListFindings'</a>, <a>listFindings_nextToken</a> -
--   You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>ListFindings</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListFindings'</a>, <a>listFindings_maxResults</a> -
--   You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArns:ListFindings'</a>,
--   <a>listFindings_assessmentRunArns</a> - The ARNs of the assessment
--   runs that generate the findings that you want to list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListFindings'</a>, <a>listFindings_filter</a> - You
--   can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included in
--   the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
newListFindings :: ListFindings

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>ListFindings</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
listFindings_nextToken :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe Text)

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
listFindings_maxResults :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe Int)

-- | The ARNs of the assessment runs that generate the findings that you
--   want to list.
listFindings_assessmentRunArns :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe [Text])

-- | You can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included
--   in the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
listFindings_filter :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe FindingFilter)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListFindingsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListFindingsResponse
ListFindingsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [Text] -> ListFindingsResponse

-- | When a response is generated, if there is more data to be listed, this
--   parameter is present in the response and contains the value to use for
--   the <b>nextToken</b> parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If
--   there is no more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.
[$sel:nextToken:ListFindingsResponse'] :: ListFindingsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListFindingsResponse'] :: ListFindingsResponse -> Int

-- | A list of ARNs that specifies the findings returned by the action.

-- | List exclusions that are generated by the assessment run.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.ListExclusions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListExclusions</a> smart constructor.
data ListExclusions
ListExclusions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ListExclusions

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the ListExclusionsRequest
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill nextToken in the request
--   with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue
--   listing data.
[$sel:nextToken:ListExclusions'] :: ListExclusions -> Maybe Text

--   want in the response. The default value is 100. The maximum value is
--   500.
[$sel:maxResults:ListExclusions'] :: ListExclusions -> Maybe Int

--   want to list.

--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   existing event subscriptions.

--   targets that are specified by the ARNs of the assessment targets.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   this parameter to null on your first call to the

--   in the action's response.

--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.

--   with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response to
--   continue listing data.

-- | Lists the ARNs of the assessment targets within this AWS account. For
--   more information about assessment targets, see <a>Amazon Inspector
--   Assessment Targets</a>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.ListAssessmentTargets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssessmentTargets</a> smart constructor.
data ListAssessmentTargets
ListAssessmentTargets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe AssessmentTargetFilter -> ListAssessmentTargets

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the
--   <b>ListAssessmentTargets</b> action. Subsequent calls to the action
--   fill <b>nextToken</b> in the request with the value of
--   <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response to continue listing data.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAssessmentTargets'] :: ListAssessmentTargets -> Maybe Text

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is

--   that are specified by the ARNs of the assessment templates.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Information about the data that is collected for the specified
--   assessment run.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.GetTelemetryMetadata

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTelemetryMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data GetTelemetryMetadata
GetTelemetryMetadata' :: Text -> GetTelemetryMetadata

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment run that has the telemetry data
--   that you want to obtain.
[$sel:assessmentRunArn:GetTelemetryMetadata'] :: GetTelemetryMetadata -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetTelemetryMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:GetTelemetryMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>getTelemetryMetadata_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN that specifies
--   the assessment run that has the telemetry data that you want to
--   obtain.
newGetTelemetryMetadata :: Text -> GetTelemetryMetadata

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment run that has the telemetry data
--   that you want to obtain.
getTelemetryMetadata_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' GetTelemetryMetadata Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTelemetryMetadataResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetTelemetryMetadataResponse
GetTelemetryMetadataResponse' :: Int -> [TelemetryMetadata] -> GetTelemetryMetadataResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetTelemetryMetadataResponse'] :: GetTelemetryMetadataResponse -> Int

-- | Telemetry details.
[$sel:telemetryMetadata:GetTelemetryMetadataResponse'] :: GetTelemetryMetadataResponse -> [TelemetryMetadata]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetTelemetryMetadataResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetTelemetryMetadataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTelemetryMetadataResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:telemetryMetadata:GetTelemetryMetadataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTelemetryMetadataResponse_telemetryMetadata</a> - Telemetry
--   details.
newGetTelemetryMetadataResponse :: Int -> GetTelemetryMetadataResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
getTelemetryMetadataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetTelemetryMetadataResponse Int

-- | Telemetry details.
getTelemetryMetadataResponse_telemetryMetadata :: Lens' GetTelemetryMetadataResponse [TelemetryMetadata]

-- | Retrieves the exclusions preview (a list of ExclusionPreview objects)
--   specified by the preview token. You can obtain the preview token by
--   running the CreateExclusionsPreview API.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.GetExclusionsPreview

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetExclusionsPreview</a> smart constructor.
data GetExclusionsPreview
GetExclusionsPreview' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Locale -> Text -> Text -> GetExclusionsPreview

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the
--   GetExclusionsPreviewRequest action. Subsequent calls to the action
--   fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the
--   previous response to continue listing data.
[$sel:nextToken:GetExclusionsPreview'] :: GetExclusionsPreview -> Maybe Text

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 100. The maximum value is
--   500.
[$sel:maxResults:GetExclusionsPreview'] :: GetExclusionsPreview -> Maybe Int

-- | The locale into which you want to translate the exclusion's title,
--   description, and recommendation.
[$sel:locale:GetExclusionsPreview'] :: GetExclusionsPreview -> Maybe Locale

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template for which the
--   exclusions preview was requested.
[$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:GetExclusionsPreview'] :: GetExclusionsPreview -> Text

-- | The unique identifier associated of the exclusions preview.
[$sel:previewToken:GetExclusionsPreview'] :: GetExclusionsPreview -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetExclusionsPreview</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetExclusionsPreview'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreview_nextToken</a> - You can use this parameter
--   when paginating results. Set the value of this parameter to null on
--   your first call to the GetExclusionsPreviewRequest action. Subsequent
--   calls to the action fill nextToken in the request with the value of
--   nextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetExclusionsPreview'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreview_maxResults</a> - You can use this parameter to
--   indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. The
--   default value is 100. The maximum value is 500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:GetExclusionsPreview'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreview_locale</a> - The locale into which you want to
--   translate the exclusion's title, description, and recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:GetExclusionsPreview'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreview_assessmentTemplateArn</a> - The ARN that
--   specifies the assessment template for which the exclusions preview was
--   requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previewToken:GetExclusionsPreview'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreview_previewToken</a> - The unique identifier
--   associated of the exclusions preview.
newGetExclusionsPreview :: Text -> Text -> GetExclusionsPreview

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the
--   GetExclusionsPreviewRequest action. Subsequent calls to the action
--   fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the
--   previous response to continue listing data.
getExclusionsPreview_nextToken :: Lens' GetExclusionsPreview (Maybe Text)

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 100. The maximum value is
--   500.
getExclusionsPreview_maxResults :: Lens' GetExclusionsPreview (Maybe Int)

-- | The locale into which you want to translate the exclusion's title,
--   description, and recommendation.
getExclusionsPreview_locale :: Lens' GetExclusionsPreview (Maybe Locale)

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template for which the
--   exclusions preview was requested.
getExclusionsPreview_assessmentTemplateArn :: Lens' GetExclusionsPreview Text

-- | The unique identifier associated of the exclusions preview.
getExclusionsPreview_previewToken :: Lens' GetExclusionsPreview Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetExclusionsPreviewResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetExclusionsPreviewResponse
GetExclusionsPreviewResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [ExclusionPreview] -> Int -> PreviewStatus -> GetExclusionsPreviewResponse

-- | When a response is generated, if there is more data to be listed, this
--   parameters is present in the response and contains the value to use
--   for the nextToken parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If
--   there is no more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.
[$sel:nextToken:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'] :: GetExclusionsPreviewResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the exclusions included in the preview.
[$sel:exclusionPreviews:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'] :: GetExclusionsPreviewResponse -> Maybe [ExclusionPreview]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'] :: GetExclusionsPreviewResponse -> Int

-- | Specifies the status of the request to generate an exclusions preview.
[$sel:previewStatus:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'] :: GetExclusionsPreviewResponse -> PreviewStatus

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   generated, if there is more data to be listed, this parameters is
--   present in the response and contains the value to use for the
--   nextToken parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If there is no
--   more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusionPreviews:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreviewResponse_exclusionPreviews</a> - Information
--   about the exclusions included in the preview.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreviewResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:previewStatus:GetExclusionsPreviewResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getExclusionsPreviewResponse_previewStatus</a> - Specifies the
--   status of the request to generate an exclusions preview.
newGetExclusionsPreviewResponse :: Int -> PreviewStatus -> GetExclusionsPreviewResponse

--   parameters is present in the response and contains the value to use
--   for the nextToken parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If

-- | Produces an assessment report that includes detailed and comprehensive
--   results of a specified assessment run.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAssessmentReport</a> smart constructor.
data GetAssessmentReport
GetAssessmentReport' :: Text -> ReportFileFormat -> ReportType -> GetAssessmentReport

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment run for which you want to
--   generate a report.
[$sel:assessmentRunArn:GetAssessmentReport'] :: GetAssessmentReport -> Text

-- | Specifies the file format (html or pdf) of the assessment report that
--   you want to generate.
[$sel:reportFileFormat:GetAssessmentReport'] :: GetAssessmentReport -> ReportFileFormat

-- | Specifies the type of the assessment report that you want to generate.
--   There are two types of assessment reports: a finding report and a full
--   report. For more information, see <a>Assessment Reports</a>.
[$sel:reportType:GetAssessmentReport'] :: GetAssessmentReport -> ReportType

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAssessmentReport</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:GetAssessmentReport'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReport_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN that specifies
--   the assessment run for which you want to generate a report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportFileFormat:GetAssessmentReport'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReport_reportFileFormat</a> - Specifies the file
--   format (html or pdf) of the assessment report that you want to
--   generate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportType:GetAssessmentReport'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReport_reportType</a> - Specifies the type of the
--   assessment report that you want to generate. There are two types of
--   assessment reports: a finding report and a full report. For more
--   information, see <a>Assessment Reports</a>.
newGetAssessmentReport :: Text -> ReportFileFormat -> ReportType -> GetAssessmentReport

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment run for which you want to
--   generate a report.
getAssessmentReport_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' GetAssessmentReport Text

-- | Specifies the file format (html or pdf) of the assessment report that
--   you want to generate.
getAssessmentReport_reportFileFormat :: Lens' GetAssessmentReport ReportFileFormat

-- | Specifies the type of the assessment report that you want to generate.
--   There are two types of assessment reports: a finding report and a full
--   report. For more information, see <a>Assessment Reports</a>.
getAssessmentReport_reportType :: Lens' GetAssessmentReport ReportType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAssessmentReportResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetAssessmentReportResponse
GetAssessmentReportResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> ReportStatus -> GetAssessmentReportResponse

-- | Specifies the URL where you can find the generated assessment report.
--   This parameter is only returned if the report is successfully
--   generated.
[$sel:url:GetAssessmentReportResponse'] :: GetAssessmentReportResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetAssessmentReportResponse'] :: GetAssessmentReportResponse -> Int

-- | Specifies the status of the request to generate an assessment report.
[$sel:status:GetAssessmentReportResponse'] :: GetAssessmentReportResponse -> ReportStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAssessmentReportResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:GetAssessmentReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReportResponse_url</a> - Specifies the URL where you
--   can find the generated assessment report. This parameter is only
--   returned if the report is successfully generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetAssessmentReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReportResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:GetAssessmentReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReportResponse_status</a> - Specifies the status of
--   the request to generate an assessment report.
newGetAssessmentReportResponse :: Int -> ReportStatus -> GetAssessmentReportResponse

-- | Specifies the URL where you can find the generated assessment report.
--   This parameter is only returned if the report is successfully
--   generated.
getAssessmentReportResponse_url :: Lens' GetAssessmentReportResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getAssessmentReportResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetAssessmentReportResponse Int

-- | Specifies the status of the request to generate an assessment report.
getAssessmentReportResponse_status :: Lens' GetAssessmentReportResponse ReportStatus

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport.GetAssessmentReport
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport.GetAssessmentReport
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport.GetAssessmentReport
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport.GetAssessmentReportResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport.GetAssessmentReportResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.GetAssessmentReport.GetAssessmentReportResponse
