-- | Describes the rules packages that are specified by the ARNs of the
--   rules packages.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeRulesPackages

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeRulesPackages</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeRulesPackages
DescribeRulesPackages' :: Maybe Locale -> NonEmpty Text -> DescribeRulesPackages

-- | The locale that you want to translate a rules package description
--   into.
[$sel:locale:DescribeRulesPackages'] :: DescribeRulesPackages -> Maybe Locale

-- | The ARN that specifies the rules package that you want to describe.
[$sel:rulesPackageArns:DescribeRulesPackages'] :: DescribeRulesPackages -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRulesPackages</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:DescribeRulesPackages'</a>,
--   <a>describeRulesPackages_locale</a> - The locale that you want to
--   translate a rules package description into.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rulesPackageArns:DescribeRulesPackages'</a>,
--   <a>describeRulesPackages_rulesPackageArns</a> - The ARN that specifies
--   the rules package that you want to describe.
newDescribeRulesPackages :: NonEmpty Text -> DescribeRulesPackages

-- | The locale that you want to translate a rules package description
--   into.
describeRulesPackages_locale :: Lens' DescribeRulesPackages (Maybe Locale)

-- | The ARN that specifies the rules package that you want to describe.
describeRulesPackages_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' DescribeRulesPackages (NonEmpty Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeRulesPackagesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeRulesPackagesResponse
DescribeRulesPackagesResponse' :: Int -> [RulesPackage] -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails -> DescribeRulesPackagesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeRulesPackagesResponse'] :: DescribeRulesPackagesResponse -> Int

-- | Information about the rules package.
[$sel:rulesPackages:DescribeRulesPackagesResponse'] :: DescribeRulesPackagesResponse -> [RulesPackage]

-- | Rules package details that cannot be described. An error code is
--   provided for each failed item.
[$sel:failedItems:DescribeRulesPackagesResponse'] :: DescribeRulesPackagesResponse -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRulesPackagesResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeRulesPackagesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRulesPackagesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rulesPackages:DescribeRulesPackagesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRulesPackagesResponse_rulesPackages</a> - Information about
--   the rules package.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedItems:DescribeRulesPackagesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRulesPackagesResponse_failedItems</a> - Rules package
--   details that cannot be described. An error code is provided for each
--   failed item.
newDescribeRulesPackagesResponse :: Int -> DescribeRulesPackagesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeRulesPackagesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeRulesPackagesResponse Int

-- | Information about the rules package.
describeRulesPackagesResponse_rulesPackages :: Lens' DescribeRulesPackagesResponse [RulesPackage]

-- | Rules package details that cannot be described. An error code is
--   provided for each failed item.
describeRulesPackagesResponse_failedItems :: Lens' DescribeRulesPackagesResponse (HashMap Text FailedItemDetails)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeRulesPackages.DescribeRulesPackages

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeRulesPackages.DescribeRulesPackages

-- | Describes the findings that are specified by the ARNs of the findings.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeFindings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeFindings</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeFindings
DescribeFindings' :: Maybe Locale -> NonEmpty Text -> DescribeFindings

-- | The locale into which you want to translate a finding description,
--   recommendation, and the short description that identifies the finding.
[$sel:locale:DescribeFindings'] :: DescribeFindings -> Maybe Locale

-- | The ARN that specifies the finding that you want to describe.
[$sel:findingArns:DescribeFindings'] :: DescribeFindings -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeFindings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:DescribeFindings'</a>, <a>describeFindings_locale</a> -
--   The locale into which you want to translate a finding description,
--   recommendation, and the short description that identifies the finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingArns:DescribeFindings'</a>,
--   <a>describeFindings_findingArns</a> - The ARN that specifies the
--   finding that you want to describe.
newDescribeFindings :: NonEmpty Text -> DescribeFindings

-- | The locale into which you want to translate a finding description,
--   recommendation, and the short description that identifies the finding.
describeFindings_locale :: Lens' DescribeFindings (Maybe Locale)

-- | The ARN that specifies the finding that you want to describe.
describeFindings_findingArns :: Lens' DescribeFindings (NonEmpty Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeFindingsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeFindingsResponse
DescribeFindingsResponse' :: Int -> [Finding] -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails -> DescribeFindingsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeFindingsResponse'] :: DescribeFindingsResponse -> Int

-- | Information about the finding.
[$sel:findings:DescribeFindingsResponse'] :: DescribeFindingsResponse -> [Finding]

-- | Finding details that cannot be described. An error code is provided
--   for each failed item.
[$sel:failedItems:DescribeFindingsResponse'] :: DescribeFindingsResponse -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeFindingsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findings:DescribeFindingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeFindingsResponse_findings</a> - Information about the
--   finding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedItems:DescribeFindingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeFindingsResponse_failedItems</a> - Finding details that
--   cannot be described. An error code is provided for each failed item.

-- | Information about the finding.
describeFindingsResponse_findings :: Lens' DescribeFindingsResponse [Finding]

--   for each failed item.

-- | Describes the exclusions that are specified by the exclusions' ARNs.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeExclusions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeExclusions</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeExclusions
DescribeExclusions' :: Maybe Locale -> NonEmpty Text -> DescribeExclusions

-- | The locale into which you want to translate the exclusion's title,
--   description, and recommendation.
[$sel:locale:DescribeExclusions'] :: DescribeExclusions -> Maybe Locale

-- | The list of ARNs that specify the exclusions that you want to
--   describe.
[$sel:exclusionArns:DescribeExclusions'] :: DescribeExclusions -> NonEmpty Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeExclusions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:locale:DescribeExclusions'</a>,
--   <a>describeExclusions_locale</a> - The locale into which you want to
--   translate the exclusion's title, description, and recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusionArns:DescribeExclusions'</a>,
--   <a>describeExclusions_exclusionArns</a> - The list of ARNs that
--   specify the exclusions that you want to describe.
newDescribeExclusions :: NonEmpty Text -> DescribeExclusions

-- | The locale into which you want to translate the exclusion's title,
--   description, and recommendation.
describeExclusions_locale :: Lens' DescribeExclusions (Maybe Locale)

-- | The list of ARNs that specify the exclusions that you want to
--   describe.
describeExclusions_exclusionArns :: Lens' DescribeExclusions (NonEmpty Text)

data DescribeExclusionsResponse
DescribeExclusionsResponse' :: Int -> HashMap Text Exclusion -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails -> DescribeExclusionsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeExclusionsResponse'] :: DescribeExclusionsResponse -> Int

-- | Information about the exclusions.
[$sel:exclusions:DescribeExclusionsResponse'] :: DescribeExclusionsResponse -> HashMap Text Exclusion

-- | Exclusion details that cannot be described. An error code is provided
--   for each failed item.
[$sel:failedItems:DescribeExclusionsResponse'] :: DescribeExclusionsResponse -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeExclusionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exclusions:DescribeExclusionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeExclusionsResponse_exclusions</a> - Information about the
--   exclusions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedItems:DescribeExclusionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeExclusionsResponse_failedItems</a> - Exclusion details that
--   cannot be described. An error code is provided for each failed item.
newDescribeExclusionsResponse :: Int -> DescribeExclusionsResponse

describeExclusionsResponse_exclusions :: Lens' DescribeExclusionsResponse (HashMap Text Exclusion)

--   for each failed item.

-- | Describes the IAM role that enables Amazon Inspector to access your
--   AWS account.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeCrossAccountAccessRole

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeCrossAccountAccessRole</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeCrossAccountAccessRole
DescribeCrossAccountAccessRole' :: DescribeCrossAccountAccessRole

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeCrossAccountAccessRole</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDescribeCrossAccountAccessRole :: DescribeCrossAccountAccessRole

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse
DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse' :: Int -> Text -> Bool -> POSIX -> DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'] :: DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN that specifies the IAM role that Amazon Inspector uses to
--   access your AWS account.
[$sel:roleArn:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'] :: DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse -> Text

-- | A Boolean value that specifies whether the IAM role has the necessary
--   policies attached to enable Amazon Inspector to access your AWS
--   account.
[$sel:valid:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'] :: DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse -> Bool

-- | The date when the cross-account access role was registered.
[$sel:registeredAt:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'] :: DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_roleArn</a> - The ARN that
--   specifies the IAM role that Amazon Inspector uses to access your AWS
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:valid:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_valid</a> - A Boolean value
--   that specifies whether the IAM role has the necessary policies
--   attached to enable Amazon Inspector to access your AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registeredAt:DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_registeredAt</a> - The date
--   when the cross-account access role was registered.
newDescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse :: Int -> Text -> Bool -> UTCTime -> DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse Int

-- | The ARN that specifies the IAM role that Amazon Inspector uses to
--   access your AWS account.
describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_roleArn :: Lens' DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse Text

-- | A Boolean value that specifies whether the IAM role has the necessary
--   policies attached to enable Amazon Inspector to access your AWS
--   account.
describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_valid :: Lens' DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse Bool

-- | The date when the cross-account access role was registered.
describeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse_registeredAt :: Lens' DescribeCrossAccountAccessRoleResponse UTCTime

--   provided for each failed item.
[$sel:failedItems:DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse'] :: DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssessmentRunsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRuns:DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssessmentRunsResponse_assessmentRuns</a> - Information
--   about the assessment run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedItems:DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssessmentRunsResponse_failedItems</a> - Assessment run
--   details that cannot be described. An error code is provided for each
--   failed item.
newDescribeAssessmentRunsResponse :: Int -> DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeAssessmentRunsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse Int

-- | Information about the assessment run.
describeAssessmentRunsResponse_assessmentRuns :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse [AssessmentRun]

-- | Assessment run details that cannot be described. An error code is
--   provided for each failed item.
describeAssessmentRunsResponse_failedItems :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse (HashMap Text FailedItemDetails)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRuns
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRuns
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRuns
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRuns
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRuns
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Inspector.DescribeAssessmentRuns.DescribeAssessmentRunsResponse

-- | Creates a resource group using the specified set of tags (key and
--   value pairs) that are used to select the EC2 instances to be included
--   in an Amazon Inspector assessment target. The created resource group
--   is then used to create an Amazon Inspector assessment target. For more
--   information, see CreateAssessmentTarget.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateResourceGroup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateResourceGroup</a> smart constructor.
data CreateResourceGroup
CreateResourceGroup' :: NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag -> CreateResourceGroup

-- | A collection of keys and an array of possible values,
--   '[{"key":"key1","values":["Value1","Value2"]},{"key":"Key2","values":["Value3"]}]'.
--   
--   For example,'[{"key":"Name","values":["TestEC2Instance"]}]'.
[$sel:resourceGroupTags:CreateResourceGroup'] :: CreateResourceGroup -> NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateResourceGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceGroupTags:CreateResourceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createResourceGroup_resourceGroupTags</a> - A collection of keys
--   and an array of possible values,
--   '[{"key":"key1","values":["Value1","Value2"]},{"key":"Key2","values":["Value3"]}]'.
--   
--   For example,'[{"key":"Name","values":["TestEC2Instance"]}]'.
newCreateResourceGroup :: NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag -> CreateResourceGroup

-- | A collection of keys and an array of possible values,
--   '[{"key":"key1","values":["Value1","Value2"]},{"key":"Key2","values":["Value3"]}]'.
--   
--   For example,'[{"key":"Name","values":["TestEC2Instance"]}]'.
createResourceGroup_resourceGroupTags :: Lens' CreateResourceGroup (NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag)

--   fields omitted.

-- | Starts the generation of an exclusions preview for the specified
--   assessment template. The exclusions preview lists the potential
--   exclusions (ExclusionPreview) that Inspector can detect before it runs
--   the assessment.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateExclusionsPreview

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateExclusionsPreview</a> smart constructor.
data CreateExclusionsPreview
CreateExclusionsPreview' :: Text -> CreateExclusionsPreview

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template for which you want to
--   create an exclusions preview.

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateExclusionsPreview</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:CreateExclusionsPreview'</a>,
--   <a>createExclusionsPreview_assessmentTemplateArn</a> - The ARN that
--   specifies the assessment template for which you want to create an
--   exclusions preview.
newCreateExclusionsPreview :: Text -> CreateExclusionsPreview

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template for which you want to
--   create an exclusions preview.
createExclusionsPreview_assessmentTemplateArn :: Lens' CreateExclusionsPreview Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateExclusionsPreviewResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse
CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse'] :: CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse -> Int

-- | Specifies the unique identifier of the requested exclusions preview.
--   You can use the unique identifier to retrieve the exclusions preview
--   when running the GetExclusionsPreview API.
[$sel:previewToken:CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse'] :: CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateExclusionsPreviewResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   http status code.

--   <a>createExclusionsPreviewResponse_previewToken</a> - Specifies the
--   unique identifier of the requested exclusions preview. You can use the

-- | Creates an assessment template for the assessment target that is
--   specified by the ARN of the assessment target. If the
--   <a>service-linked role</a> isn’t already registered, this action also
--   creates and registers a service-linked role to grant Amazon Inspector
--   access to AWS Services needed to perform security assessments.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssessmentTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAssessmentTemplate
CreateAssessmentTemplate' :: Maybe [Attribute] -> Text -> Text -> Natural -> [Text] -> CreateAssessmentTemplate

-- | The user-defined attributes that are assigned to every finding that is
--   generated by the assessment run that uses this assessment template. An
--   attribute is a key and value pair (an Attribute object). Within an
--   assessment template, each key must be unique.
[$sel:userAttributesForFindings:CreateAssessmentTemplate'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplate -> Maybe [Attribute]

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment target for which you want to
--   create the assessment template.
[$sel:assessmentTargetArn:CreateAssessmentTemplate'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplate -> Text

-- | The user-defined name that identifies the assessment template that you
--   want to create. You can create several assessment templates for an
--   assessment target. The names of the assessment templates that
--   correspond to a particular assessment target must be unique.
[$sel:assessmentTemplateName:CreateAssessmentTemplate'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplate -> Text

-- | The duration of the assessment run in seconds.
[$sel:durationInSeconds:CreateAssessmentTemplate'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplate -> Natural

-- | The ARNs that specify the rules packages that you want to attach to
--   the assessment template.
[$sel:rulesPackageArns:CreateAssessmentTemplate'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplate -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssessmentTemplate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userAttributesForFindings:CreateAssessmentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplate_userAttributesForFindings</a> - The
--   user-defined attributes that are assigned to every finding that is
--   generated by the assessment run that uses this assessment template. An
--   attribute is a key and value pair (an Attribute object). Within an
--   assessment template, each key must be unique.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTargetArn:CreateAssessmentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplate_assessmentTargetArn</a> - The ARN that
--   specifies the assessment target for which you want to create the
--   assessment template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTemplateName:CreateAssessmentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplate_assessmentTemplateName</a> - The
--   user-defined name that identifies the assessment template that you
--   want to create. You can create several assessment templates for an
--   assessment target. The names of the assessment templates that
--   correspond to a particular assessment target must be unique.
--   
--   <a>$sel:durationInSeconds:CreateAssessmentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplate_durationInSeconds</a> - The duration of
--   the assessment run in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rulesPackageArns:CreateAssessmentTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplate_rulesPackageArns</a> - The ARNs that
--   specify the rules packages that you want to attach to the assessment
--   template.
newCreateAssessmentTemplate :: Text -> Text -> Natural -> CreateAssessmentTemplate

-- | The user-defined attributes that are assigned to every finding that is
--   generated by the assessment run that uses this assessment template. An
--   attribute is a key and value pair (an Attribute object). Within an
--   assessment template, each key must be unique.
createAssessmentTemplate_userAttributesForFindings :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplate (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment target for which you want to
--   create the assessment template.
createAssessmentTemplate_assessmentTargetArn :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplate Text

-- | The user-defined name that identifies the assessment template that you
--   want to create. You can create several assessment templates for an
--   assessment target. The names of the assessment templates that
--   correspond to a particular assessment target must be unique.
createAssessmentTemplate_assessmentTemplateName :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplate Text

-- | The duration of the assessment run in seconds.
createAssessmentTemplate_durationInSeconds :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplate Natural

-- | The ARNs that specify the rules packages that you want to attach to
--   the assessment template.
createAssessmentTemplate_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplate [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssessmentTemplateResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse
CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template that is created.
[$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse'] :: CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplateResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTemplateArn:CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTemplateResponse_assessmentTemplateArn</a> - The
--   ARN that specifies the assessment template that is created.
newCreateAssessmentTemplateResponse :: Int -> Text -> CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
createAssessmentTemplateResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse Int

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template that is created.
createAssessmentTemplateResponse_assessmentTemplateArn :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplate
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplateResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTemplate.CreateAssessmentTemplate


-- | Creates a new assessment target using the ARN of the resource group
--   that is generated by CreateResourceGroup. If resourceGroupArn is not
--   specified, all EC2 instances in the current AWS account and region are
--   included in the assessment target. If the <a>service-linked role</a>
--   isn’t already registered, this action also creates and registers a
--   service-linked role to grant Amazon Inspector access to AWS Services
--   needed to perform security assessments. You can create up to 50
--   assessment targets per AWS account. You can run up to 500 concurrent
--   agents per AWS account. For more information, see <a>Amazon Inspector
--   Assessment Targets</a>.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssessmentTarget</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAssessmentTarget
CreateAssessmentTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> CreateAssessmentTarget

-- | The ARN that specifies the resource group that is used to create the
--   assessment target. If resourceGroupArn is not specified, all EC2
--   instances in the current AWS account and region are included in the
--   assessment target.
[$sel:resourceGroupArn:CreateAssessmentTarget'] :: CreateAssessmentTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | The user-defined name that identifies the assessment target that you
--   want to create. The name must be unique within the AWS account.
[$sel:assessmentTargetName:CreateAssessmentTarget'] :: CreateAssessmentTarget -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssessmentTarget</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceGroupArn:CreateAssessmentTarget'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTarget_resourceGroupArn</a> - The ARN that
--   specifies the resource group that is used to create the assessment
--   target. If resourceGroupArn is not specified, all EC2 instances in the
--   current AWS account and region are included in the assessment target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTargetName:CreateAssessmentTarget'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTarget_assessmentTargetName</a> - The user-defined
--   name that identifies the assessment target that you want to create.
--   The name must be unique within the AWS account.
newCreateAssessmentTarget :: Text -> CreateAssessmentTarget

-- | The ARN that specifies the resource group that is used to create the
--   assessment target. If resourceGroupArn is not specified, all EC2
--   instances in the current AWS account and region are included in the
--   assessment target.
createAssessmentTarget_resourceGroupArn :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The user-defined name that identifies the assessment target that you
--   want to create. The name must be unique within the AWS account.
createAssessmentTarget_assessmentTargetName :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTarget Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssessmentTargetResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateAssessmentTargetResponse
CreateAssessmentTargetResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CreateAssessmentTargetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateAssessmentTargetResponse'] :: CreateAssessmentTargetResponse -> Int

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment target that is created.
[$sel:assessmentTargetArn:CreateAssessmentTargetResponse'] :: CreateAssessmentTargetResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssessmentTargetResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateAssessmentTargetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTargetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentTargetArn:CreateAssessmentTargetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAssessmentTargetResponse_assessmentTargetArn</a> - The ARN
--   that specifies the assessment target that is created.
newCreateAssessmentTargetResponse :: Int -> Text -> CreateAssessmentTargetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
createAssessmentTargetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTargetResponse Int

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment target that is created.
createAssessmentTargetResponse_assessmentTargetArn :: Lens' CreateAssessmentTargetResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTargetResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTargetResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTargetResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTargetResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTargetResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Inspector.CreateAssessmentTarget.CreateAssessmentTarget


-- | Assigns attributes (key and value pairs) to the findings that are
--   specified by the ARNs of the findings.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAddAttributesToFindings</a> smart constructor.
data AddAttributesToFindings
AddAttributesToFindings' :: NonEmpty Text -> [Attribute] -> AddAttributesToFindings

-- | The ARNs that specify the findings that you want to assign attributes
--   to.
[$sel:findingArns:AddAttributesToFindings'] :: AddAttributesToFindings -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The array of attributes that you want to assign to specified findings.
[$sel:attributes:AddAttributesToFindings'] :: AddAttributesToFindings -> [Attribute]

-- | Create a value of <a>AddAttributesToFindings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingArns:AddAttributesToFindings'</a>,
--   <a>addAttributesToFindings_findingArns</a> - The ARNs that specify the
--   findings that you want to assign attributes to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:AddAttributesToFindings'</a>,
--   <a>addAttributesToFindings_attributes</a> - The array of attributes
--   that you want to assign to specified findings.
newAddAttributesToFindings :: NonEmpty Text -> AddAttributesToFindings

-- | The ARNs that specify the findings that you want to assign attributes
--   to.
addAttributesToFindings_findingArns :: Lens' AddAttributesToFindings (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The array of attributes that you want to assign to specified findings.
addAttributesToFindings_attributes :: Lens' AddAttributesToFindings [Attribute]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAddAttributesToFindingsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AddAttributesToFindingsResponse
AddAttributesToFindingsResponse' :: Int -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails -> AddAttributesToFindingsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AddAttributesToFindingsResponse'] :: AddAttributesToFindingsResponse -> Int

-- | Attribute details that cannot be described. An error code is provided
--   for each failed item.
[$sel:failedItems:AddAttributesToFindingsResponse'] :: AddAttributesToFindingsResponse -> HashMap Text FailedItemDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>AddAttributesToFindingsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AddAttributesToFindingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>addAttributesToFindingsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failedItems:AddAttributesToFindingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>addAttributesToFindingsResponse_failedItems</a> - Attribute details
--   that cannot be described. An error code is provided for each failed
--   item.
newAddAttributesToFindingsResponse :: Int -> AddAttributesToFindingsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
addAttributesToFindingsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AddAttributesToFindingsResponse Int

-- | Attribute details that cannot be described. An error code is provided
--   for each failed item.
addAttributesToFindingsResponse_failedItems :: Lens' AddAttributesToFindingsResponse (HashMap Text FailedItemDetails)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindingsResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindingsResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Inspector.AddAttributesToFindings.AddAttributesToFindings


-- | Disables the process of sending Amazon Simple Notification Service
--   (SNS) notifications about a specified event to a specified SNS topic.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.UnsubscribeFromEvent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribeFromEvent</a> smart constructor.
data UnsubscribeFromEvent
UnsubscribeFromEvent' :: Text -> InspectorEvent -> Text -> UnsubscribeFromEvent

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which you want to stop receiving SNS notifications.
[$sel:resourceArn:UnsubscribeFromEvent'] :: UnsubscribeFromEvent -> Text

-- | The event for which you want to stop receiving SNS notifications.
[$sel:event:UnsubscribeFromEvent'] :: UnsubscribeFromEvent -> InspectorEvent

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to which SNS notifications are sent.
[$sel:topicArn:UnsubscribeFromEvent'] :: UnsubscribeFromEvent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UnsubscribeFromEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:UnsubscribeFromEvent'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromEvent_resourceArn</a> - The ARN of the assessment
--   template that is used during the event for which you want to stop
--   receiving SNS notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:event:UnsubscribeFromEvent'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromEvent_event</a> - The event for which you want to
--   stop receiving SNS notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:UnsubscribeFromEvent'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeFromEvent_topicArn</a> - The ARN of the SNS topic to
--   which SNS notifications are sent.
newUnsubscribeFromEvent :: Text -> InspectorEvent -> Text -> UnsubscribeFromEvent

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which you want to stop receiving SNS notifications.
unsubscribeFromEvent_resourceArn :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromEvent Text

-- | The event for which you want to stop receiving SNS notifications.
unsubscribeFromEvent_event :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromEvent InspectorEvent

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to which SNS notifications are sent.
unsubscribeFromEvent_topicArn :: Lens' UnsubscribeFromEvent Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribeFromEventResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UnsubscribeFromEventResponse
UnsubscribeFromEventResponse' :: UnsubscribeFromEventResponse

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

-- | Updates the assessment target that is specified by the ARN of the
--   assessment target.
--   
--   If resourceGroupArn is not specified, all EC2 instances in the current
--   AWS account and region are included in the assessment target.
module Network.AWS.Inspector.UpdateAssessmentTarget

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAssessmentTarget</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAssessmentTarget

--   group to associate with the assessment target.

module Network.AWS.Inspector.Lens

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment template that you want to
--   delete.
deleteAssessmentTemplate_assessmentTemplateArn :: Lens' DeleteAssessmentTemplate Text

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which you want to receive SNS notifications.
subscribeToEvent_resourceArn :: Lens' SubscribeToEvent Text

-- | The event for which you want to receive SNS notifications.
subscribeToEvent_event :: Lens' SubscribeToEvent InspectorEvent

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to which the SNS notifications are sent.
subscribeToEvent_topicArn :: Lens' SubscribeToEvent Text

-- | An input option that can be set to either START_EVALUATION or
--   SKIP_EVALUATION. START_EVALUATION (the default value), stops the AWS
--   agent from collecting data and begins the results evaluation and the
--   findings generation process. SKIP_EVALUATION cancels the assessment
--   run immediately, after which no findings are generated.
stopAssessmentRun_stopAction :: Lens' StopAssessmentRun (Maybe StopAction)

-- | The ARN of the assessment run that you want to stop.
stopAssessmentRun_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' StopAssessmentRun Text

-- | You can specify the name for the assessment run. The name must be
--   unique for the assessment template whose ARN is used to start the
--   assessment run.
startAssessmentRun_assessmentRunName :: Lens' StartAssessmentRun (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the assessment template of the assessment run that you want
--   to start.
startAssessmentRun_assessmentTemplateArn :: Lens' StartAssessmentRun Text

-- | The response's http status code.
startAssessmentRunResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartAssessmentRunResponse Int

-- | The ARN of the assessment run that has been started.
startAssessmentRunResponse_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' StartAssessmentRunResponse Text

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>ListFindings</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
listFindings_nextToken :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe Text)

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
listFindings_maxResults :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe Int)

-- | The ARNs of the assessment runs that generate the findings that you
--   want to list.
listFindings_assessmentRunArns :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe [Text])

-- | You can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included
--   in the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
listFindings_filter :: Lens' ListFindings (Maybe FindingFilter)

-- | When a response is generated, if there is more data to be listed, this
--   parameter is present in the response and contains the value to use for
--   the <b>nextToken</b> parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If
--   there is no more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.
listFindingsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListFindingsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listFindingsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListFindingsResponse Int

-- | A list of ARNs that specifies the findings returned by the action.
listFindingsResponse_findingArns :: Lens' ListFindingsResponse [Text]

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment run that has the telemetry data
--   that you want to obtain.
getTelemetryMetadata_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' GetTelemetryMetadata Text

-- | The response's http status code.
getTelemetryMetadataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetTelemetryMetadataResponse Int

-- | Telemetry details.
getTelemetryMetadataResponse_telemetryMetadata :: Lens' GetTelemetryMetadataResponse [TelemetryMetadata]

-- | The ARNs that specifies the assessment targets that you want to
--   describe.
describeAssessmentTargets_assessmentTargetArns :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentTargets (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeAssessmentTargetsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentTargetsResponse Int

-- | Information about the assessment targets.
describeAssessmentTargetsResponse_assessmentTargets :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentTargetsResponse [AssessmentTarget]

-- | Assessment target details that cannot be described. An error code is
--   provided for each failed item.
describeAssessmentTargetsResponse_failedItems :: Lens' DescribeAssessmentTargetsResponse (HashMap Text FailedItemDetails)

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the
--   <b>ListAssessmentRuns</b> action. Subsequent calls to the action fill
--   <b>nextToken</b> in the request with the value of <b>NextToken</b>
--   from the previous response to continue listing data.
listAssessmentRuns_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssessmentRuns (Maybe Text)

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items
--   that you want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum
--   value is 500.
listAssessmentRuns_maxResults :: Lens' ListAssessmentRuns (Maybe Int)

-- | You can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included
--   in the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
listAssessmentRuns_filter :: Lens' ListAssessmentRuns (Maybe AssessmentRunFilter)

-- | The ARNs that specify the assessment templates whose assessment runs
--   you want to list.
listAssessmentRuns_assessmentTemplateArns :: Lens' ListAssessmentRuns (Maybe [Text])

-- | When a response is generated, if there is more data to be listed, this
--   parameter is present in the response and contains the value to use for
--   the <b>nextToken</b> parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If
--   there is no more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.
listAssessmentRunsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssessmentRunsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listAssessmentRunsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListAssessmentRunsResponse Int

-- | A list of ARNs that specifies the assessment runs that are returned by
--   the action.
listAssessmentRunsResponse_assessmentRunArns :: Lens' ListAssessmentRunsResponse [Text]

-- | The ARN that specifies the assessment target that you want to delete.
deleteAssessmentTarget_assessmentTargetArn :: Lens' DeleteAssessmentTarget Text

-- | You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the
--   <b>ListAssessmentTargets</b> action. Subsequent calls to the action
--   fill <b>nextToken</b> in the request with the value of
--   <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response to continue listing data.
listAssessmentTargets_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssessmentTargets (Maybe Text)

-- | You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
listAssessmentTargets_maxResults :: Lens' ListAssessmentTargets (Maybe Int)

-- | You can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included
--   in the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
listAssessmentTargets_filter :: Lens' ListAssessmentTargets (Maybe AssessmentTargetFilter)

-- | When a response is generated, if there is more data to be listed, this
--   parameter is present in the response and contains the value to use for
--   the <b>nextToken</b> parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If
--   there is no more data to be listed, this parameter is set to null.
listAssessmentTargetsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssessmentTargetsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listAssessmentTargetsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListAssessmentTargetsResponse Int

-- | A list of ARNs that specifies the assessment targets that are returned
--   by the action.

--   group to associate with the assessment target.

--   provided for each failed item.

--   assessment target. If resourceGroupArn is not specified, all EC2
--   instances in the current AWS account and region are included in the
--   assessment target.

--   want to create. The name must be unique within the AWS account.

--   finding.

assessmentRun_stateChangedAt :: Lens' AssessmentRun UTCTime

--   collecting data from the agents is completed.
assessmentRun_dataCollected :: Lens' AssessmentRun Bool

-- | A list of notifications for the event subscriptions. A notification
--   about a particular generated finding is added to this list only once.
assessmentRun_notifications :: Lens' AssessmentRun [AssessmentRunNotification]

-- | Provides a total count of generated findings per severity.
assessmentRun_findingCounts :: Lens' AssessmentRun (HashMap Severity Int)

assessmentRunAgent_agentId :: Lens' AssessmentRunAgent Text

assessmentRunAgent_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' AssessmentRunAgent Text

-- | The current health state of the agent.
assessmentRunAgent_agentHealth :: Lens' AssessmentRunAgent AgentHealth

-- | The detailed health state of the agent.
assessmentRunAgent_agentHealthCode :: Lens' AssessmentRunAgent AgentHealthCode

-- | The Amazon Inspector application data metrics that are collected by
--   the agent.
assessmentRunAgent_telemetryMetadata :: Lens' AssessmentRunAgent [TelemetryMetadata]

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values specified for this
--   data type property must be the exact match of the value of the
--   <b>assessmentRunState</b> property of the AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_states :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe [AssessmentRunState])

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must inclusively match any value between the
--   specified minimum and maximum values of the <b>durationInSeconds</b>
--   property of the AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_durationRange :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe DurationRange)

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must be contained in the list of values of the
--   <b>rulesPackages</b> property of the AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must match the <b>stateChangedAt</b> property of
--   the AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_stateChangeTimeRange :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe TimestampRange)

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must inclusively match any value between the
--   specified minimum and maximum values of the <b>startTime</b> property
--   of the AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_startTimeRange :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe TimestampRange)

-- | For a record to match a filter, an explicit value or a string
--   containing a wildcard that is specified for this data type property
--   must match the value of the <b>assessmentRunName</b> property of the
--   AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_namePattern :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must inclusively match any value between the
--   specified minimum and maximum values of the <b>completedAt</b>
--   property of the AssessmentRun data type.
assessmentRunFilter_completionTimeRange :: Lens' AssessmentRunFilter (Maybe TimestampRange)

-- | The message included in the notification.
assessmentRunNotification_message :: Lens' AssessmentRunNotification (Maybe Text)

-- | The status code of the SNS notification.
assessmentRunNotification_snsPublishStatusCode :: Lens' AssessmentRunNotification (Maybe AssessmentRunNotificationSnsStatusCode)

-- | The SNS topic to which the SNS notification is sent.
assessmentRunNotification_snsTopicArn :: Lens' AssessmentRunNotification (Maybe Text)

-- | The date of the notification.
assessmentRunNotification_date :: Lens' AssessmentRunNotification UTCTime

-- | The event for which a notification is sent.
assessmentRunNotification_event :: Lens' AssessmentRunNotification InspectorEvent

-- | The Boolean value that specifies whether the notification represents
--   an error.
assessmentRunNotification_error :: Lens' AssessmentRunNotification Bool

-- | The last time the assessment run state changed.
assessmentRunStateChange_stateChangedAt :: Lens' AssessmentRunStateChange UTCTime

-- | The assessment run state.
assessmentRunStateChange_state :: Lens' AssessmentRunStateChange AssessmentRunState

-- | The ARN that specifies the resource group that is associated with the
--   assessment target.
assessmentTarget_resourceGroupArn :: Lens' AssessmentTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN that specifies the Amazon Inspector assessment target.
assessmentTarget_arn :: Lens' AssessmentTarget Text

-- | The name of the Amazon Inspector assessment target.
assessmentTarget_name :: Lens' AssessmentTarget Text

-- | The time at which the assessment target is created.
assessmentTarget_createdAt :: Lens' AssessmentTarget UTCTime

-- | The time at which UpdateAssessmentTarget is called.
assessmentTarget_updatedAt :: Lens' AssessmentTarget UTCTime

-- | For a record to match a filter, an explicit value or a string that
--   contains a wildcard that is specified for this data type property must
--   match the value of the <b>assessmentTargetName</b> property of the
--   AssessmentTarget data type.
assessmentTargetFilter_assessmentTargetNamePattern :: Lens' AssessmentTargetFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the most recent assessment run
--   associated with this assessment template. This value exists only when
--   the value of assessmentRunCount is greaterpa than zero.
assessmentTemplate_lastAssessmentRunArn :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the assessment template.
assessmentTemplate_arn :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate Text

-- | The name of the assessment template.
assessmentTemplate_name :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate Text

-- | The ARN of the assessment target that corresponds to this assessment
--   template.
assessmentTemplate_assessmentTargetArn :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate Text

-- | The duration in seconds specified for this assessment template. The
--   default value is 3600 seconds (one hour). The maximum value is 86400
--   seconds (one day).
assessmentTemplate_durationInSeconds :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate Natural

-- | The rules packages that are specified for this assessment template.
assessmentTemplate_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate [Text]

-- | The user-defined attributes that are assigned to every generated
--   finding from the assessment run that uses this assessment template.
assessmentTemplate_userAttributesForFindings :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate [Attribute]

-- | The number of existing assessment runs associated with this assessment
--   template. This value can be zero or a positive integer.
assessmentTemplate_assessmentRunCount :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate Int

-- | The time at which the assessment template is created.
assessmentTemplate_createdAt :: Lens' AssessmentTemplate UTCTime

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value specified for this data type
--   property must inclusively match any value between the specified
--   minimum and maximum values of the <b>durationInSeconds</b> property of
--   the AssessmentTemplate data type.
assessmentTemplateFilter_durationRange :: Lens' AssessmentTemplateFilter (Maybe DurationRange)

-- | For a record to match a filter, the values that are specified for this
--   data type property must be contained in the list of values of the
--   <b>rulesPackageArns</b> property of the AssessmentTemplate data type.
assessmentTemplateFilter_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' AssessmentTemplateFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | For a record to match a filter, an explicit value or a string that
--   contains a wildcard that is specified for this data type property must
--   match the value of the <b>assessmentTemplateName</b> property of the
--   AssessmentTemplate data type.
assessmentTemplateFilter_namePattern :: Lens' AssessmentTemplateFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | The hostname of the EC2 instance where the finding is generated.
assetAttributes_hostname :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the agent that is installed on the EC2 instance where the
--   finding is generated.
assetAttributes_agentId :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that is installed on the EC2
--   instance where the finding is generated.
assetAttributes_amiId :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags related to the EC2 instance where the finding is generated.
assetAttributes_tags :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The list of IP v4 addresses of the EC2 instance where the finding is
--   generated.
assetAttributes_ipv4Addresses :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of the network interfaces interacting with the EC2 instance
--   where the finding is generated.
assetAttributes_networkInterfaces :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe [NetworkInterface])

-- | The Auto Scaling group of the EC2 instance where the finding is
--   generated.
assetAttributes_autoScalingGroup :: Lens' AssetAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema version of this data type.
assetAttributes_schemaVersion :: Lens' AssetAttributes Natural

-- | The value assigned to the attribute key.
attribute_value :: Lens' Attribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The attribute key.
attribute_key :: Lens' Attribute Text

-- | The minimum value of the duration range. Must be greater than zero.
durationRange_minSeconds :: Lens' DurationRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | The maximum value of the duration range. Must be less than or equal to
--   604800 seconds (1 week).
durationRange_maxSeconds :: Lens' DurationRange (Maybe Natural)

-- | The event for which Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)
--   notifications are sent.
eventSubscription_event :: Lens' EventSubscription InspectorEvent

-- | The time at which SubscribeToEvent is called.
eventSubscription_subscribedAt :: Lens' EventSubscription UTCTime

-- | The system-defined attributes for the exclusion.
exclusion_attributes :: Lens' Exclusion (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | The ARN that specifies the exclusion.
exclusion_arn :: Lens' Exclusion Text

-- | The name of the exclusion.
exclusion_title :: Lens' Exclusion Text

-- | The description of the exclusion.
exclusion_description :: Lens' Exclusion Text

-- | The recommendation for the exclusion.
exclusion_recommendation :: Lens' Exclusion Text

-- | The AWS resources for which the exclusion pertains.
exclusion_scopes :: Lens' Exclusion (NonEmpty Scope)

-- | The system-defined attributes for the exclusion preview.
exclusionPreview_attributes :: Lens' ExclusionPreview (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | The name of the exclusion preview.
exclusionPreview_title :: Lens' ExclusionPreview Text

-- | The description of the exclusion preview.
exclusionPreview_description :: Lens' ExclusionPreview Text

-- | The recommendation for the exclusion preview.
exclusionPreview_recommendation :: Lens' ExclusionPreview Text

-- | The AWS resources for which the exclusion preview pertains.
exclusionPreview_scopes :: Lens' ExclusionPreview (NonEmpty Scope)

-- | The status code of a failed item.
failedItemDetails_failureCode :: Lens' FailedItemDetails FailedItemErrorCode

-- | Indicates whether you can immediately retry a request for this item
--   for a specified resource.
failedItemDetails_retryable :: Lens' FailedItemDetails Bool

-- | A collection of attributes of the host from which the finding is
--   generated.
finding_assetAttributes :: Lens' Finding (Maybe AssetAttributes)

-- | The finding severity. Values can be set to High, Medium, Low, and
--   Informational.
finding_severity :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Severity)

-- | The type of the host from which the finding is generated.
finding_assetType :: Lens' Finding (Maybe AssetType)

-- | The numeric value of the finding severity.
finding_numericSeverity :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Double)

-- | The name of the finding.
finding_title :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the finding.
finding_id :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The data element is set to "Inspector".
finding_service :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | This data type is used in the Finding data type.
finding_serviceAttributes :: Lens' Finding (Maybe InspectorServiceAttributes)

-- | This data element is currently not used.
finding_confidence :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Natural)

-- | The recommendation for the finding.
finding_recommendation :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | This data element is currently not used.
finding_indicatorOfCompromise :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the finding.
finding_description :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema version of this data type.
finding_schemaVersion :: Lens' Finding (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ARN that specifies the finding.
finding_arn :: Lens' Finding Text

-- | The system-defined attributes for the finding.
finding_attributes :: Lens' Finding [Attribute]

-- | The user-defined attributes that are assigned to the finding.
finding_userAttributes :: Lens' Finding [Attribute]

-- | The time when the finding was generated.
finding_createdAt :: Lens' Finding UTCTime

-- | The time when AddAttributesToFindings is called.
finding_updatedAt :: Lens' Finding UTCTime

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>agentId</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_agentIds :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>rulesPackageArn</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_rulesPackageArns :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | The time range during which the finding is generated.
findingFilter_creationTimeRange :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe TimestampRange)

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>severity</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_severities :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Severity])

-- | For a record to match a filter, the list of values that are specified
--   for this data type property must be contained in the list of values of
--   the <b>attributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_attributes :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | For a record to match a filter, the value that is specified for this
--   data type property must be contained in the list of values of the
--   <b>userAttributes</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_userAttributes :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Attribute])

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>autoScalingGroup</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_autoScalingGroups :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | For a record to match a filter, one of the values that is specified
--   for this data type property must be the exact match of the value of
--   the <b>ruleName</b> property of the Finding data type.
findingFilter_ruleNames :: Lens' FindingFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ARN of the rules package that is used to generate the finding.
inspectorServiceAttributes_rulesPackageArn :: Lens' InspectorServiceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the assessment run during which the finding is generated.
inspectorServiceAttributes_assessmentRunArn :: Lens' InspectorServiceAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The schema version of this data type.
inspectorServiceAttributes_schemaVersion :: Lens' InspectorServiceAttributes Natural

-- | A list of the private IP addresses associated with the network
--   interface. Includes the privateDnsName and privateIpAddress.
networkInterface_privateIpAddresses :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe [PrivateIp])

-- | The IP addresses associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_ipv6Addresses :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of the security groups associated with the network interface.
--   Includes the groupId and groupName.
networkInterface_securityGroups :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe [SecurityGroup])

-- | The name of a public DNS associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_publicDnsName :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a subnet associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_subnetId :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the network interface.
networkInterface_networkInterfaceId :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a private DNS associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_privateDnsName :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a VPC associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_vpcId :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The public IP address from which the network interface is reachable.
networkInterface_publicIp :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address associated with the network interface.
networkInterface_privateIpAddress :: Lens' NetworkInterface (Maybe Text)

-- | The DNS name of the private IP address.
privateIp_privateDnsName :: Lens' PrivateIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The full IP address of the network inteface.
privateIp_privateIpAddress :: Lens' PrivateIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the resource group.
resourceGroup_arn :: Lens' ResourceGroup Text

-- | The tags (key and value pairs) of the resource group. This data type
--   property is used in the CreateResourceGroup action.
resourceGroup_tags :: Lens' ResourceGroup (NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag)

-- | The time at which resource group is created.
resourceGroup_createdAt :: Lens' ResourceGroup UTCTime

-- | The value assigned to a tag key.
resourceGroupTag_value :: Lens' ResourceGroupTag (Maybe Text)

-- | A tag key.
resourceGroupTag_key :: Lens' ResourceGroupTag Text

-- | The description of the rules package.
rulesPackage_description :: Lens' RulesPackage (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the rules package.
rulesPackage_arn :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The name of the rules package.
rulesPackage_name :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The version ID of the rules package.
rulesPackage_version :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The provider of the rules package.
rulesPackage_provider :: Lens' RulesPackage Text

-- | The type of the scope.
scope_key :: Lens' Scope (Maybe ScopeType)

-- | The resource identifier for the specified scope type.
scope_value :: Lens' Scope (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the security group.
securityGroup_groupName :: Lens' SecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the security group.
securityGroup_groupId :: Lens' SecurityGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the assessment template that is used during the event for
--   which the SNS notification is sent.
subscription_resourceArn :: Lens' Subscription Text

-- | The ARN of the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic to which
--   the SNS notifications are sent.
subscription_topicArn :: Lens' Subscription Text

-- | The list of existing event subscriptions.
subscription_eventSubscriptions :: Lens' Subscription (NonEmpty EventSubscription)

-- | A value assigned to a tag key.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | A tag key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The data size of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
telemetryMetadata_dataSize :: Lens' TelemetryMetadata (Maybe Integer)

-- | A specific type of behavioral data that is collected by the agent.
telemetryMetadata_messageType :: Lens' TelemetryMetadata Text

-- | The count of messages that the agent sends to the Amazon Inspector
--   service.
telemetryMetadata_count :: Lens' TelemetryMetadata Integer

-- | The minimum value of the timestamp range.
timestampRange_beginDate :: Lens' TimestampRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The maximum value of the timestamp range.
timestampRange_endDate :: Lens' TimestampRange (Maybe UTCTime)


module Network.AWS.Inspector.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2016-02-16</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Inspector
--   
--   Amazon Inspector enables you to analyze the behavior of your AWS
--   resources and to identify potential security issues. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Inspector User Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Inspector

-- | API version <tt>2016-02-16</tt> of the Amazon Inspector SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request is rejected. The specified assessment template is
--   currently generating an exclusions preview.
_PreviewGenerationInProgressException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The serice is temporary unavailable.
_ServiceTemporarilyUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Used by the GetAssessmentReport API. The request was rejected because
--   you tried to generate a report for an assessment run that existed
--   before reporting was supported in Amazon Inspector. You can only
--   generate reports for assessment runs that took place or will take
--   place after generating reports in Amazon Inspector became available.
_UnsupportedFeatureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because an invalid or out-of-range value was
--   supplied for an input parameter.
_InvalidInputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Internal server error.
_InternalException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Amazon Inspector cannot assume the cross-account role that it needs to
--   list your EC2 instances during the assessment run.
_InvalidCrossAccountRoleException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You started an assessment run, but one of the instances is already
--   participating in another assessment run.
_AgentsAlreadyRunningAssessmentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You cannot perform a specified action if an assessment run is
--   currently in progress.
_AssessmentRunInProgressException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You do not have required permissions to access the requested resource.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it attempted to create resources
--   beyond the current AWS account limits. The error code describes the
--   limit exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it referenced an entity that does not
--   exist. The error code describes the entity.
_NoSuchEntityException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

data StopAssessmentRun

-- | Create a value of <a>StopAssessmentRun</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopAction:StopAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>stopAssessmentRun_stopAction</a> - An input option that can be set
--   to either START_EVALUATION or SKIP_EVALUATION. START_EVALUATION (the
--   default value), stops the AWS agent from collecting data and begins
--   the results evaluation and the findings generation process.
--   SKIP_EVALUATION cancels the assessment run immediately, after which no
--   findings are generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:StopAssessmentRun'</a>,
--   <a>stopAssessmentRun_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN of the assessment
--   run that you want to stop.

--   template whose ARN is used to start the assessment run.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListFindings</a> smart constructor.
data ListFindings
ListFindings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe FindingFilter -> ListFindings

-- | Create a value of <a>ListFindings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListFindings'</a>, <a>listFindings_nextToken</a> -
--   You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the <b>ListFindings</b>
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill <b>nextToken</b> in the
--   request with the value of <b>NextToken</b> from the previous response
--   to continue listing data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListFindings'</a>, <a>listFindings_maxResults</a> -
--   You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you
--   want in the response. The default value is 10. The maximum value is
--   500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArns:ListFindings'</a>,
--   <a>listFindings_assessmentRunArns</a> - The ARNs of the assessment
--   runs that generate the findings that you want to list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListFindings'</a>, <a>listFindings_filter</a> - You
--   can use this parameter to specify a subset of data to be included in
--   the action's response.
--   
--   For a record to match a filter, all specified filter attributes must
--   match. When multiple values are specified for a filter attribute, any
--   of the values can match.
newListFindings :: ListFindings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListFindingsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListFindingsResponse

--   - You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of
--   this parameter to null on your first call to the ListExclusionsRequest
--   action. Subsequent calls to the action fill nextToken in the request
--   with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue
--   listing data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListExclusions'</a>,
--   <a>listExclusions_maxResults</a> - You can use this parameter to
--   indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. The
--   default value is 100. The maximum value is 500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assessmentRunArn:ListExclusions'</a>,
--   <a>listExclusions_assessmentRunArn</a> - The ARN of the assessment run
--   that generated the exclusions that you want to list.
newListExclusions :: Text -> ListExclusions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListExclusionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListExclusionsResponse

--   nextToken parameter in a subsequent pagination request. If there is no

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateResourceGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceGroupTags:CreateResourceGroup'</a>,
--   <a>createResourceGroup_resourceGroupTags</a> - A collection of keys
--   and an array of possible values,
--   '[{"key":"key1","values":["Value1","Value2"]},{"key":"Key2","values":["Value3"]}]'.
--   
--   For example,'[{"key":"Name","values":["TestEC2Instance"]}]'.
newCreateResourceGroup :: NonEmpty ResourceGroupTag -> CreateResourceGroup

--   <a>getAssessmentReport_reportFileFormat</a> - Specifies the file
--   format (html or pdf) of the assessment report that you want to
--   generate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportType:GetAssessmentReport'</a>,
--   <a>getAssessmentReport_reportType</a> - Specifies the type of the
--   assessment report that you want to generate. There are two types of
--   assessment reports: a finding report and a full report. For more
--   information, see <a>Assessment Reports</a>.
newGetAssessmentReport :: Text -> ReportFileFormat -> ReportType -> GetAssessmentReport
